items.title: City Adds 600,000 People to Storm Evacuation Zones
items.abstract: A revised system, based on hurricane storm-surge data, includes more zones and covers 37 percent of all New York City residences.

items.title: In New York’s Strictest No-Parking Zones, Not Even the F.B.I. Is Exempt
items.abstract: For decades, the federal agency’s vehicles were off limits to tow trucks, but the New York Police Department has recently taken away hundreds of cars belonging to governmental entities.

items.title: Trump Administration Presses Cities to Evict Homeowners From Flood Zones
items.abstract: The Trump administration is starting to insist that towns use eminent domain laws  to force homeowners off flood-prone land. Notices are already going out.

items.title: Police Clear Seattle’s Protest ‘Autonomous Zone’
items.abstract: The so-called Capitol Hill Organized Protest area was taken over by protesters after the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis. It was the site of at least four shootings last month.

items.title: In Rural ‘Dead Zones,’ School Comes on a Flash Drive
items.abstract: Millions of American students lack reliable internet access. Some are learning in parking lots connected to Wi-Fi buses or crashing with relatives to get online.
